name: tawdrily
content:
tawdrily adverb
(LOW QUALITY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is of low quality: Three weeks into January, some cheap Christmas decorations still hung tawdrily in the windows of the shop. These tawdrily produced old novels were meant to be disposable but can now fetch serious money from collectors.
More examplesFewer examplesHis apartment was tawdrily furnished with threadbare chairs and a sofa acquired at a garage sale.

tawdrily adverb
(IMMORALLY)
in a way that shows or has low moral standards: The movie is a tawdrily entertaining tale about a doomed love affair that leads to murder. The producers of the chat show tawdrily exploited the couple's story for the sake of ratings.
